summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from November 2021 and earlier in 2021 between Assistant United States Attorney Amanda K. Kramer and other individuals from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The emails discuss scheduling calls related to a pre-trial motion opposition deadline and reference sharing notes from a February 2016 meeting and an article about the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Amanda K. Kramer
persons.context: The primary correspondent in the email chain, scheduling calls with other AUSAs regarding a pre-trial motion opposition deadline and case-related materials.

events.title: 2016 Meeting Referenced
events.description: Mention of notes from a meeting in February 2016, which were to be shared with Amanda Kramer.

events.title: Scheduled Call
events.description: A call was scheduled for 10:30 AM between Amanda Kramer and other AUSAs to discuss a brief filing deadline.

events.title: Brief Filing Deadline
events.description: Mention of a deadline to file a pre-trial motion opposition brief on Friday, February 26, 2021.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The emails involve Assistant U.S. Attorney Amanda K. Kramer scheduling calls with colleagues regarding a pre-trial motion opposition deadline in early 2021.
The correspondence references sharing "notes from a meeting in February 2016" and a link to a New York Daily News article about the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The communication highlights coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on case-related matters.
The email chain shows external email tagging ([EXTERNAL]) and includes redacted or generic email addresses for other parties.
